title: How to Make Stuffed Jalapenos

methods.name: Cream cheese and bacon stuffed jalapeños

steps.headline: Cut the jalapeños in half.
steps.description: It's a good idea to wear kitchen gloves when cutting jalapeños or other hot peppers; otherwise, the capsaicin oil that makes them spicy can burn your hands. Then, using a spoon, scoop out the white rinds and the seeds inside the jalapeños halves (these will make the jalapeños too hot to be edible unless they are removed before cooking).

steps.headline: Stuff each jalapeño half with whipped cream cheese.
Wrap a half slice of bacon around each stuffed jalapeño half.
Place the wrapped jalapeño halves in one layer on a medium baking sheet.
Bake the peppers in the preheated oven for 45 minutes or until the bacon is evenly browned and crisp.
Parboil the peppers.
steps.description: Do this for 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from the water and set aside.

steps.headline: Mix the cream cheese, grated cheese and shrimp together.
Add seasonings.
steps.description: Add salt and pepper to taste, and the garlic powder and cumin.

steps.headline: Cut the peppers lengthwise.
steps.description: Scoop out the middle seeds and the membranes. Wear gloves when doing this and do not rub your eyes or nose while handling the peppers.

steps.headline: Stuff the cheese mixture inside the halved peppers.
steps.description: Wrap with either bacon or prosciutto.

steps.headline: Place on a baking sheet.
steps.description: Bake at a moderate temperature for 25 minutes, until the outside wrap turns crispy.

tyn: Oven or grill (able to heat to 400ºF)
text: Cream cheese and bacon stuffed jalapeños Preheat oven to 400 degrees.  Cut the jalapeños in half. It's a good idea to wear kitchen gloves when cutting jalapeños or other hot peppers; otherwise, the capsaicin oil that makes them spicy can burn your hands. Then, using a spoon, scoop out the white rinds and the seeds inside the jalapeños halves (these will make the jalapeños too hot to be edible unless they are removed before cooking). Stuff each jalapeño half with whipped cream cheese.  Wrap a half slice of bacon around each stuffed jalapeño half.  Place the wrapped jalapeño halves in one layer on a medium baking sheet.  Bake the peppers in the preheated oven for 45 minutes or until the bacon is evenly browned and crisp.  Finished.  Shrimp and cheese stuffed jalapeños Parboil the peppers. Do this for 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from the water and set aside. Peel the shrimp. Chop into ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) pieces. Grate the cheese.  Mix the cream cheese, grated cheese and shrimp together.  Add seasonings. Add salt and pepper to taste, and the garlic powder and cumin. Cut the peppers lengthwise. Scoop out the middle seeds and the membranes. Wear gloves when doing this and do not rub your eyes or nose while handling the peppers. Stuff the cheese mixture inside the halved peppers. Wrap with either bacon or prosciutto. Place on a baking sheet. Bake at a moderate temperature for 25 minutes, until the outside wrap turns crispy. Serve straight from the oven.
sentences: Cream cheese and bacon stuffed jalapeños Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Cut the jalapeños in half.
It's a good idea to wear kitchen gloves when cutting jalapeños or other hot peppers; otherwise, the capsaicin oil that makes them spicy can burn your hands.
Then, using a spoon, scoop out the white rinds and the seeds inside the jalapeños halves (these will make the jalapeños too hot to be edible unless they are removed before cooking).
Stuff each jalapeño half with whipped cream cheese.
Wrap a half slice of bacon around each stuffed jalapeño half.
Place the wrapped jalapeño halves in one layer on a medium baking sheet.
Bake the peppers in the preheated oven for 45 minutes or until the bacon is evenly browned and crisp.
Finished.
Shrimp and cheese stuffed jalapeños Parboil the peppers.
Do this for 10 to 15 minutes.
Remove from the water and set aside.
Peel the shrimp.
Chop into ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) pieces.
Grate the cheese.
Mix the cream cheese, grated cheese and shrimp together.
Add seasonings.
Add salt and pepper to taste, and the garlic powder and cumin.
Cut the peppers lengthwise.
Scoop out the middle seeds and the membranes.
Wear gloves when doing this and do not rub your eyes or nose while handling the peppers.
Stuff the cheese mixture inside the halved peppers.
Wrap with either bacon or prosciutto.
Place on a baking sheet.
Bake at a moderate temperature for 25 minutes, until the outside wrap turns crispy.
Serve straight from the oven.
